qas.question: What book details the submission of Jesus to being crucified?
What theme is central is the Gospel of John in resurrection?
How is Resurrection detailed in the book of Revelations?
What is another name for Jesus given?

plausible_answers.text: for the sake of eventual victory

qas.question: Why did Johannine accept who would be saved?
What book was written by John the Baptist?
What sacrifice did John the Baptist make as an agent of?
What did John the Baptist want to take away?
What did Johannine believe he was not?

context: In Johannine <b6_0>"<a0_0>agent Christology<a0_0/>"<b6_0/> the submission of Jesus to crucifixion is a sacrifice made as an agent of <b7_0>God<b7_0/> or servant of God, <b5_0>for the <a1_0>sake of eventual victory<b5_0/><a1_0/>. This builds on the <a2_0>salvific theme<a2_0/> of the Gospel of John which begins in John 1:29 with John the Baptist's proclamation: "<a4_0>The Lamb of God<a4_0/> who takes away <b8_0>the sins of the world<b8_0/>". Further reinforcement of the concept is provided in Revelation 21:14 where the "<a3_0>lamb slain but standing<a3_0/>" is the only one <b9_0>worthy<b9_0/> of handling the scroll (i.e. the book) containing the names of those who are to be saved.
